articles.description: Almost 500 people have died from the virus across the county's hospitals
articles.content:
Two more people have died from coronavirus in Hertfordshire hospitals, new figures show.
The latest data from NHS England shows that there are now 498 patients in the county's hospitals who have died after contracting Covid-19.
This is a rise of two from ye… [+7550 chars]

articles.title: Sweden becomes country with highest coronavirus death rate per capita - Telegraph.co.uk
articles.description: Sweden has 6.08 deaths per million inhabitants, higher than the UK, USA and Italy
articles.content:
Sweden has now overtaken the UK, Italy and Belgium to have the highest coronavirus per capita death rate in the world, throwing its decision to avoid a strict lockdown into further doubt.
According to figures collated by the Our World in Data website, Sweden… [+1407 chars]

articles.author: Amy Barrett, PA Science
articles.title: Coronavirus in saliva could travel more than 5m in a 'slight breeze' - sciencefocus.com
articles.description: The new study warns coughing will spread infected droplets further than you might think, and that shorter adults and children could be at greater risk.
articles.content:
Staying two metres apart may not be far enough to stop outdoor coronavirus transmission, a study has suggested.
Research from the American Institute of Physics has found saliva droplets can travel more than five metres in five seconds if there a slight breez… [+4490 chars]

articles.title: North Wales continues to record the most new coronavirus cases in the country - North Wales Live
articles.description: 215 people have now died after contracting Covid-19 in the Betsi Cadwaladr University Health Board area
articles.content:
Another 14 people have died after testing positive for coronavirus in Wales, bringing the total number to 1,238.

articles.title: Coronavirus deaths in Bristol reach 200 - with half from care homes - Bristol Post
articles.description: The Office for National Statistics has released the most recent data at a local level
articles.content:
The number of people who have died with coronavirus in Bristol has now exceeded 200. 
New figures released by the Office for National Statistics, which record coronavirus-related deaths in the city up to May 8, show that the total now stands at 206.

articles.title: Coronavirus: Washing hands at least six times a day cuts infection risk by over a third - study - Sky News
articles.description: A report says hand-washing on a frequent basis reduces the chances of contracting the disease by 36%.

articles.content:
